channel.title: Ice Hockey on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Ice Hockey on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lehigh Valley Phantoms Logo
The Lehigh Valley Phantoms are a professional ice hockey team in the American Hockey League based at the PPL Center in Allentown, Pennsylvania, a core city of the Lehigh Valley. The Phantoms franchise has been the top minor league affiliate for the NHL’s Philadelphia Flyers since the 1996–97 season, previously playing in Philadelphia as the Philadelphia Phantoms until 2009, and in Glens Falls, New York, as the Adirondack Phantoms until 2014.
You can download theLehigh Valley Phantomslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Lehigh Valley Phantoms
item.description: The Lehigh Valley Phantoms are a professional ice hockey team in the American Hockey League based at the PPL Center in Allentown, Pennsylvania, a core city of the Lehigh Valley. The Phantoms franchise has been the top minor league affiliate for the NHL’s Philadelphia Flyers since the 1996–97 season, previously playing in Philadelphia as the Philadelphia Phantoms until 2009, and in Glens Falls, New York, as the Adirondack Phantoms until 2014.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Atlanta Gladiators Logo
The Atlanta Gladiators are a professional minor league ice hockey team based in Duluth, Georgia. The Gladiators play in the South Division of the ECHL’s Eastern Conference. They play their home games at Gas South Arena, approximately 22 miles northeast of Atlanta. The franchise originated as the Mobile Mysticks in 1995. They suspended operations in 2002 and moved to Duluth in 2003 where they were originally known as the Gwinnett Gladiators.
You can download theAtlanta Gladiatorslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Atlanta Gladiators
item.description: The Atlanta Gladiators are a professional minor league ice hockey team based in Duluth, Georgia. The Gladiators play in the South Division of the ECHL’s Eastern Conference. They play their home games at Gas South Arena, approximately 22 miles northeast of Atlanta. The franchise originated as the Mobile Mysticks in 1995. They suspended operations in 2002 and moved to Duluth in 2003 where they were originally known as the Gwinnett Gladiators.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Alabama Huntsville Chargers Logo
The Alabama Huntsville Chargers are the intercollegiate athletic teams representing the University of Alabama in Huntsville in Huntsville, Alabama. UAH sponsors eight men’s and eight women’s varsity athletics programs. UAH is a member of the National Collegiate Athletics Association, competing in Division II in 15 sports. UAH is a member of the Gulf South Conference in all sports except men’s lacrosse. UAH was the host institution for the 2012 Frozen Four at the St.
You can download theAlabama Huntsville Chargerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Alabama Huntsville Chargers
item.description: The Alabama Huntsville Chargers are the intercollegiate athletic teams representing the University of Alabama in Huntsville in Huntsville, Alabama. UAH sponsors eight men’s and eight women’s varsity athletics programs. UAH is a member of the National Collegiate Athletics Association, competing in Division II in 15 sports. UAH is a member of the Gulf South Conference in all sports except men’s lacrosse. UAH was the host institution for the 2012 Frozen Four at the St.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Alaska Anchorage Seawolves Logo
The Alaska Anchorage Seawolves are the 13 varsity athletic teams that represent the University of Alaska Anchorage, in Anchorage, Alaska, United States, in NCAA intercollegiate sports. The vast majority of UAA’s athletic teams are in NCAA Division II with the exception of the alpine and Nordic ski, gymnastics, and ice hockey teams, which are members of Division I. The Seawolves principally compete as members of the Great Northwest Athletic Conference.
You can download theAlaska Anchorage Seawolveslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Alaska Anchorage Seawolves
item.description: The Alaska Anchorage Seawolves are the 13 varsity athletic teams that represent the University of Alaska Anchorage, in Anchorage, Alaska, United States, in NCAA intercollegiate sports. The vast majority of UAA’s athletic teams are in NCAA Division II with the exception of the alpine and Nordic ski, gymnastics, and ice hockey teams, which are members of Division I. The Seawolves principally compete as members of the Great Northwest Athletic Conference.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Alaska Nanooks Logo
The Alaska Nanooks are the University of Alaska Fairbanks sports teams, derived from the Inupiaq “nanuq.” The school colors are blue and gold. The Nanooks compete at the NCAA Division II level for all sports except men’s ice hockey. The majority of Nanooks sports are members of the Great Northwest Athletic Conference, the hockey team is a member of the WCHA and plays at the 4,595 seat Carlson Center located west of downtown Fairbanks, while the women’s swim team is a member of the Pacific Collegiate Swimming & Diving Conference, the men’s and women’s skiing teams are members of the Rocky Mountain Intercollegiate Ski Association, and the rifle team competes as a member of the Patriot Rifle Conference.
You can download theAlaska Nanookslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Alaska Nanooks
item.description: The Alaska Nanooks are the University of Alaska Fairbanks sports teams, derived from the Inupiaq “nanuq.” The school colors are blue and gold. The Nanooks compete at the NCAA Division II level for all sports except men’s ice hockey. The majority of Nanooks sports are members of the Great Northwest Athletic Conference, the hockey team is a member of the WCHA and plays at the 4,595 seat Carlson Center located west of downtown Fairbanks, while the women’s swim team is a member of the Pacific Collegiate Swimming & Diving Conference, the men’s and women’s skiing teams are members of the Rocky Mountain Intercollegiate Ski Association, and the rifle team competes as a member of the Patriot Rifle Conference.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
American International Yellow Jackets Logo
The American International Yellow Jackets is composed of 22 teams representing American International College in intercollegiate athletics, including men and women’s basketball, cross country, golf, lacrosse, soccer, and track and field. Men’s sports include baseball, football, ice hockey, and wrestling. Women’s sports include field hockey, rugby, softball, tennis, and volleyball. The Yellow Jackets compete in NCAA Division II and are members of the Northeast-10 Conference for all sports except ice hockey and women’s rugby, which compete in NCAA Division I, and wrestling, which is NCAA Division II Independent.
You can download theAmerican International Yellow Jacketslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: American International Yellow Jackets
item.description: The American International Yellow Jackets is composed of 22 teams representing American International College in intercollegiate athletics, including men and women’s basketball, cross country, golf, lacrosse, soccer, and track and field. Men’s sports include baseball, football, ice hockey, and wrestling. Women’s sports include field hockey, rugby, softball, tennis, and volleyball. The Yellow Jackets compete in NCAA Division II and are members of the Northeast-10 Conference for all sports except ice hockey and women’s rugby, which compete in NCAA Division I, and wrestling, which is NCAA Division II Independent.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Assumption College Greyhounds Logo
The Assumption College Greyhounds are the athletic sports teams for Assumption College. They are a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association under the classification of Division II. The Greyhounds are a member of the Northeast-10 Conference. Men’s sports include baseball, basketball, cross country, football, golf, ice hockey, lacrosse, soccer, tennis and track & field; women’s sports include basketball, cross country, field hockey, golf, lacrosse, rowing, soccer, softball, swimming & diving, tennis, track & field and volleyball.
You can download theAssumption College Greyhoundslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Assumption College Greyhounds
item.description: The Assumption College Greyhounds are the athletic sports teams for Assumption College. They are a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association under the classification of Division II. The Greyhounds are a member of the Northeast-10 Conference. Men’s sports include baseball, basketball, cross country, football, golf, ice hockey, lacrosse, soccer, tennis and track & field; women’s sports include basketball, cross country, field hockey, golf, lacrosse, rowing, soccer, softball, swimming & diving, tennis, track & field and volleyball.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bentley Falcons Logo
The Bentley Falcons are composed of 21 teams representing Bentley University in intercollegiate athletics, including men and women’s basketball, cross country, lacrosse, soccer, swimming & diving, tennis, and track and field. Men’s sports include baseball, football, golf, and ice hockey. Women’s sports include field hockey, softball, and volleyball. The Falcons compete in NCAA Division II and are members of the Northeast-10 Conference for all sports except the men’s ice hockey team, which competes in Division I as a member of Atlantic Hockey.
You can download theBentley Falconslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bentley Falcons
item.description: The Bentley Falcons are composed of 21 teams representing Bentley University in intercollegiate athletics, including men and women’s basketball, cross country, lacrosse, soccer, swimming & diving, tennis, and track and field. Men’s sports include baseball, football, golf, and ice hockey. Women’s sports include field hockey, softball, and volleyball. The Falcons compete in NCAA Division II and are members of the Northeast-10 Conference for all sports except the men’s ice hockey team, which competes in Division I as a member of Atlantic Hockey.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Franklin Pierce Ravens Logo The Franklin Pierce Ravens are the intercollegiate athletic teams that represent Franklin Pierce University, located in Rindge, New Hampshire, in NCAA sporting competitions. Franklin Pierce competes at the Division II level in 22 varsity sports. In terms of conferences, the Ravens are primarily members of the Northeast-10 Conference, of which it has been a member since 2000. The three exceptions are the women’s bowling team, which is a member of the East Coast Conference; the women’s ice hockey team, which competes at the National Collegiate (Division I and II) level in the New England Women’s Hockey Alliance (NEWHA); and the women’s rowing team, which competes as an independent.
You can download theFranklin Pierce Ravenslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Franklin Pierce Ravens
item.description: The Franklin Pierce Ravens are the intercollegiate athletic teams that represent Franklin Pierce University, located in Rindge, New Hampshire, in NCAA sporting competitions. Franklin Pierce competes at the Division II level in 22 varsity sports. In terms of conferences, the Ravens are primarily members of the Northeast-10 Conference, of which it has been a member since 2000. The three exceptions are the women’s bowling team, which is a member of the East Coast Conference; the women’s ice hockey team, which competes at the National Collegiate (Division I and II) level in the New England Women’s Hockey Alliance (NEWHA); and the women’s rowing team, which competes as an independent.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Wisconsin Badgers Logo
The Wisconsin Badgers are the athletic teams representing the University of Wisconsin–Madison. They compete as a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I level, primarily competing in the Big Ten Conference for all sports since the 1896–97 season. The women’s ice hockey team competes in the Western Collegiate Hockey Association, while the men’s and lightweight women’s crew team compete in the Eastern Association of Rowing Colleges. The athletic director is Barry Alvarez, former head coach of the football team.
You can download theWisconsin Badgerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Wisconsin Badgers
item.description: The Wisconsin Badgers are the athletic teams representing the University of Wisconsin–Madison. They compete as a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I level, primarily competing in the Big Ten Conference for all sports since the 1896–97 season. The women’s ice hockey team competes in the Western Collegiate Hockey Association, while the men’s and lightweight women’s crew team compete in the Eastern Association of Rowing Colleges. The athletic director is Barry Alvarez, former head coach of the football team.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Canisius Golden Griffins Logo
The Canisius College Golden Griffins are composed of 16 teams representing Canisius College in intercollegiate athletics. These teams include men’s and women’s basketball, cross country, track, lacrosse, soccer, and swimming and diving. Men’s sports include baseball, ice hockey, and golf. Women’s sports include volleyball, soccer, and softball. The Golden Griffins compete in the NCAA Division I and are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference for most sports, excluding men’s ice hockey which competes in Atlantic Hockey.
You can download theCanisius Golden Griffinslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Canisius Golden Griffins
item.description: The Canisius College Golden Griffins are composed of 16 teams representing Canisius College in intercollegiate athletics. These teams include men’s and women’s basketball, cross country, track, lacrosse, soccer, and swimming and diving. Men’s sports include baseball, ice hockey, and golf. Women’s sports include volleyball, soccer, and softball. The Golden Griffins compete in the NCAA Division I and are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference for most sports, excluding men’s ice hockey which competes in Atlantic Hockey.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Denver Pioneers Logo
The Denver Pioneers are the sports teams of the University of Denver. They play in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I. Denver is a member of The Summit League for men’s and women’s basketball, swimming and diving, men’s and women’s soccer, tennis and golf for both men and women, plus women’s volleyball. Other DU teams play in various conferences in the sports that are not sponsored by The Summit.
You can download theDenver Pioneerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Denver Pioneers
item.description: The Denver Pioneers are the sports teams of the University of Denver. They play in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I. Denver is a member of The Summit League for men’s and women’s basketball, swimming and diving, men’s and women’s soccer, tennis and golf for both men and women, plus women’s volleyball. Other DU teams play in various conferences in the sports that are not sponsored by The Summit.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Fairfield Stags Logo
The Fairfield Stags are the athletic programs representing Fairfield University in Fairfield, Connecticut. Most of the programs are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference and classified as Division I-AAA in the National Collegiate Athletic Association. The men’s and women’s golf programs are both ranked among the best in the nation for academics, according to Golf Digest. Source
You can download theFairfield Stagslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Fairfield Stags
item.description: The Fairfield Stags are the athletic programs representing Fairfield University in Fairfield, Connecticut. Most of the programs are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference and classified as Division I-AAA in the National Collegiate Athletic Association. The men’s and women’s golf programs are both ranked among the best in the nation for academics, according to Golf Digest. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Iona Gaels Logo
The Iona Gaels are the athletics teams of Iona College, in New Rochelle, New York. They compete in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference and participate in 21 NCAA Division I programs. Other members of the MAAC include Canisius College, Fairfield University, Manhattan College, Marist College, Monmouth University, Niagara University, Quinnipiac University, Rider University, Saint Peter’s University, and Siena College. Source
You can download theIona Gaelslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Iona Gaels
item.description: The Iona Gaels are the athletics teams of Iona College, in New Rochelle, New York. They compete in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference and participate in 21 NCAA Division I programs. Other members of the MAAC include Canisius College, Fairfield University, Manhattan College, Marist College, Monmouth University, Niagara University, Quinnipiac University, Rider University, Saint Peter’s University, and Siena College. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Niagara Purple Eagles Logo
The Niagara Purple Eagles are athletics teams that represent Niagara University in college sports. Part of the NCAA’s Division I, the Purple Eagles field 18 varsity level teams. The Purple Eagles are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference and Atlantic Hockey. Between 1946 and 1958, Niagara was a member of the Western New York Little Three Conference. In 2012, the women’s ice hockey program was replaced by women’s track and field.
You can download theNiagara Purple Eagleslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Niagara Purple Eagles
item.description: The Niagara Purple Eagles are athletics teams that represent Niagara University in college sports. Part of the NCAA’s Division I, the Purple Eagles field 18 varsity level teams. The Purple Eagles are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference and Atlantic Hockey. Between 1946 and 1958, Niagara was a member of the Western New York Little Three Conference. In 2012, the women’s ice hockey program was replaced by women’s track and field.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
North Dakota Fighting Hawks Logo
The North Dakota Fighting Hawks are the athletic teams that represent the University of North Dakota, located in the city of Grand Forks, North Dakota. Originally in the Division II North Central Conference, UND began transitioning to NCAA’s Division I in 2008 with the football program participating in the Division I Football Championship Subdivision. North Dakota is a member of the Summit League for most sports, an FCS independent in football, and the National Collegiate Hockey Conference for men’s hockey.
You can download theNorth Dakota Fighting Hawkslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: North Dakota Fighting Hawks
item.description: The North Dakota Fighting Hawks are the athletic teams that represent the University of North Dakota, located in the city of Grand Forks, North Dakota. Originally in the Division II North Central Conference, UND began transitioning to NCAA’s Division I in 2008 with the football program participating in the Division I Football Championship Subdivision. North Dakota is a member of the Summit League for most sports, an FCS independent in football, and the National Collegiate Hockey Conference for men’s hockey.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Omaha Mavericks Logo
The Omaha Mavericks are the sports teams of the University of Nebraska Omaha. They participate in the NCAA’s Division I and in The Summit League, except in ice hockey, where they compete in the National Collegiate Hockey Conference. Source
You can download theOmaha Maverickslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Omaha Mavericks
item.description: The Omaha Mavericks are the sports teams of the University of Nebraska Omaha. They participate in the NCAA’s Division I and in The Summit League, except in ice hockey, where they compete in the National Collegiate Hockey Conference. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Purdue Fort Wayne Mastodons Logo
The Purdue Fort Wayne Mastodons, formerly known as the IPFW Mastodons and Fort Wayne Mastodons, are the athletic teams of Purdue University Fort Wayne. The Mastodons compete as a NCAA Division I school in the Horizon League for most sports and in the Midwestern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association for men’s volleyball. It joined the Horizon League from the Summit League in July 2020. The official announcement of this move noted that PFW would be near the geographic center of its new league, with an average distance of 170 miles from the other members.
You can download thePurdue Fort Wayne Mastodonslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Purdue Fort Wayne Mastodons
item.description: The Purdue Fort Wayne Mastodons, formerly known as the IPFW Mastodons and Fort Wayne Mastodons, are the athletic teams of Purdue University Fort Wayne. The Mastodons compete as a NCAA Division I school in the Horizon League for most sports and in the Midwestern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association for men’s volleyball. It joined the Horizon League from the Summit League in July 2020. The official announcement of this move noted that PFW would be near the geographic center of its new league, with an average distance of 170 miles from the other members.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Quinnipiac Bobcats Logo
The Quinnipiac Bobcats are the 21 sports teams representing Quinnipiac University in Hamden, Connecticut in intercollegiate athletics. The Bobcats compete in the NCAA Division I and are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference, joining on July 1, 2013 after being in the Northeast Conference. The Bobcats compete outside the MAAC in three sports. Despite the MAAC sponsoring field hockey, the Bobcats moved their field hockey team into the Big East Conference in 2016.
You can download theQuinnipiac Bobcatslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Quinnipiac Bobcats
item.description: The Quinnipiac Bobcats are the 21 sports teams representing Quinnipiac University in Hamden, Connecticut in intercollegiate athletics. The Bobcats compete in the NCAA Division I and are members of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference, joining on July 1, 2013 after being in the Northeast Conference. The Bobcats compete outside the MAAC in three sports. Despite the MAAC sponsoring field hockey, the Bobcats moved their field hockey team into the Big East Conference in 2016.

Boston College Eagles Logo
The Boston College Eagles are the athletic teams that represent Boston College, located in Chestnut Hill, Massachusetts. They compete as a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I level, primarily competing in the Atlantic Coast Conference. Source
You can download theBoston College Eagleslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

Columbia Lions Logo
The Columbia University Lions are the collective athletic teams and their members from Columbia University, an Ivy League institution in New York City, United States. The current director of athletics is Peter Pilling. Source
You can download theColumbia Lionslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Columbia Lions
item.description: The Columbia University Lions are the collective athletic teams and their members from Columbia University, an Ivy League institution in New York City, United States. The current director of athletics is Peter Pilling. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Harvard Crimson Logo
The Harvard Crimson are the athletic teams of Harvard University. The school’s teams compete in NCAA Division I. As of 2013, there were 42 Division I intercollegiate varsity sports teams for women and men at Harvard, more than at any other NCAA Division I college in the country. Like the other Ivy League universities, Harvard does not offer athletic scholarships. Source
You can download theHarvard Crimsonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Harvard Crimson
item.description: The Harvard Crimson are the athletic teams of Harvard University. The school’s teams compete in NCAA Division I. As of 2013, there were 42 Division I intercollegiate varsity sports teams for women and men at Harvard, more than at any other NCAA Division I college in the country. Like the other Ivy League universities, Harvard does not offer athletic scholarships. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Missouri State Bears and Lady Bears Logo
The Missouri State Bears and Lady Bears are the athletic teams representing Missouri State University (formerly Southwest Missouri State University). Missouri State’s athletics programs date back to 1908. Missouri State competes in the NCAA Division I Football Championship Subdivision, and most teams compete in the Missouri Valley Conference. Missouri State football competes in the Missouri Valley Football Conference, while Men’s Swimming and Diving competes in the Mid-American Conference, and the beach volleyball team is a member of the Coastal Collegiate Sports Association.
You can download theMissouri State Bearslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Missouri State Bears
item.description: The Missouri State Bears and Lady Bears are the athletic teams representing Missouri State University (formerly Southwest Missouri State University). Missouri State’s athletics programs date back to 1908. Missouri State competes in the NCAA Division I Football Championship Subdivision, and most teams compete in the Missouri Valley Conference. Missouri State football competes in the Missouri Valley Football Conference, while Men’s Swimming and Diving competes in the Mid-American Conference, and the beach volleyball team is a member of the Coastal Collegiate Sports Association.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Providence Friars Logo
The Providence Friars are the intercollegiate athletic teams that represent Providence College, located in Providence, Rhode Island. They compete in the Big East Conference for every sport except for ice hockey, where they compete in Hockey East. The Big East Conference was founded in 1979 by former athletic director and men’s basketball coach Dave Gavitt. On December 15, 2012, Providence and the other seven Catholic, non-FBS schools announced that they were departing the Big East for a new conference; on March 7, 2013, it was officially confirmed that Providence’s new conference would operate under the Big East name.
You can download theProvidence Friarslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Providence Friars
item.description: The Providence Friars are the intercollegiate athletic teams that represent Providence College, located in Providence, Rhode Island. They compete in the Big East Conference for every sport except for ice hockey, where they compete in Hockey East. The Big East Conference was founded in 1979 by former athletic director and men’s basketball coach Dave Gavitt. On December 15, 2012, Providence and the other seven Catholic, non-FBS schools announced that they were departing the Big East for a new conference; on March 7, 2013, it was officially confirmed that Providence’s new conference would operate under the Big East name.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Robert Morris Colonials Logo
The Robert Morris Colonials are the athletic teams for Robert Morris University, in Moon Township, Pennsylvania, a suburb of Pittsburgh. The Colonials compete in NCAA Division I. In 2020, the school joined the Horizon League as a full member after leaving the Northeast Conference. Colonials football plays in the Big South Conference. The school colors are RMU Blue, RMU Red, and RMU Gray/Silver. In December 2013, Robert Morris announced the school was cutting seven sports programs after the 2013–14 season: men’s indoor and outdoor track, tennis and cross country and women’s golf, tennis and field hockey.
You can download theRobert Morris Colonialslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Robert Morris Colonials
item.description: The Robert Morris Colonials are the athletic teams for Robert Morris University, in Moon Township, Pennsylvania, a suburb of Pittsburgh. The Colonials compete in NCAA Division I. In 2020, the school joined the Horizon League as a full member after leaving the Northeast Conference. Colonials football plays in the Big South Conference. The school colors are RMU Blue, RMU Red, and RMU Gray/Silver. In December 2013, Robert Morris announced the school was cutting seven sports programs after the 2013–14 season: men’s indoor and outdoor track, tennis and cross country and women’s golf, tennis and field hockey.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Sacred Heart Pioneers Logo
The Sacred Heart Pioneers are the 32 sports teams representing Sacred Heart University in Fairfield, Connecticut in intercollegiate athletics. The Pioneers compete in the NCAA Division I and are members of the Northeast Conference, Atlantic Hockey, Eastern Intercollegiate Wrestling Association, Eastern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association, and New England Women’s Hockey Alliance. Source
You can download theSacred Heart Pioneerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

The Pioneers compete in the NCAA Division I and are members of the Northeast Conference, Atlantic Hockey, Eastern Intercollegiate Wrestling Association, Eastern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association, and New England Women’s Hockey Alliance. item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Yale Bulldogs Logo
The Yale Bulldogs are the athletic teams of Yale University. The school sponsors 35 varsity sports. The school has won two NCAA national championships in women’s fencing, four in men’s swimming and diving, 21 in men’s golf, one in men’s hockey and one in men’s lacrosse. Source
You can download theYale Bulldogslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Yale Bulldogs
item.description: The Yale Bulldogs are the athletic teams of Yale University. The school sponsors 35 varsity sports. The school has won two NCAA national championships in women’s fencing, four in men’s swimming and diving, 21 in men’s golf, one in men’s hockey and one in men’s lacrosse. Source
